intro: Wettinia maynensis, commonly known as the Maynense velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly in Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of soft, velvety hairs. It produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Wettinia maynensis is often found growing in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
